institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Industry-specific Human Resources Development Committee (ISC) operating rules/Article 6 (deliberation committee duties, etc.)
contents: Article 6 (Duties of the Deliberation Committee, etc.) ① The Deliberation Committee shall perform the role of review, evaluation, deliberation, and resolution on the following matters: 1. Matters related to new ISC public offering, selection, and cancellation of selection, 2. Matters pertaining to ISC's annual business plan approval and change approval. However, if it is not a change to an important matter in the annual business plan, it may not go through deliberation and resolution by the Deliberation Committee. 3. Matters related to decisions on subsidies for ISC, etc. 4. Matters related to adjustments to the existing ISC industry scope, 4-2. Matters related to changes to the existing ISC representative organization Revised January 2, 5, 2019. Matters related to the evaluation of ISC's business performance 6. Matters related to the extension of the ISC contract period and decision to terminate the contract 7. Operation and selection of a support center , agreements, matters related to business plans, 8. Matters related to implementation of industry-led youth customized training ​Newly established on December 31, 2019, 9. Other important matters related to ISC operation and business performance, etc. ② The Deliberation Committee is comprised of a majority of registered members. The meeting begins with attendance and is decided with the approval of more than two-thirds of the members present. In this case, proxy attendance by external members is not permitted, but ex officio members may have their subordinates attend on their behalf and make decisions on behalf of the member. Revised December 31, 2019, ③ In order to handle business, the Deliberation Committee may have the Corporation's working-level managers and staff in charge participate as attendees to hear practical matters and opinions. In this case, those present cannot deliberate and decide., ④ In principle, the Deliberation Committee deliberates and decides in person, but if the agenda is minor or urgent, it may decide in writing. However, resolutions cannot be made in writing more than three times in a row. Revised December 31, 2019, ⑤ The Deliberation Committee may cite the decisions of the Review Committee, Evaluation Committee, etc. established pursuant to Article 7 regarding the confirmation of ISC's annual business plan, performance evaluation results, etc. Revised January 2, 2019, ⑥ The Corporation may appoint the head of the department in charge of the project as the secretary of the deliberation committee, and may appoint employees of the department in charge of the project as headquarters personnel to support the proceedings of the deliberation committee. ⑦ When the deliberation committee is convened, the Corporation must notify the deliberation committee members of the date, time, and location of the meeting in writing or electronically (posting on the website, sending text messages, or e-mail notification) at least 5 days prior to the meeting date. Newly established on December 31, 2019, ⑧ The Corporation may pay allowances and travel expenses to members who attended the deliberation committee or participated in written resolutions in accordance with Annex 1, “Standards for payment of deliberation committee member allowances, etc.” within the scope of the budget. .
